trans-unit.source: PowerShell Engine Improvements in WMF 5.1 (Preview)
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Engine Improvements in WMF 5.1 (Preview)

trans-unit.source: PowerShell, DSC, WMF
trans-unit.target: PowerShell, DSC, WMF

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Engine Improvements
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Engine Improvements

trans-unit.source: The following improvements to the core PowerShell engine have been implemented in WMF 5.1:
trans-unit.target: The following improvements to the core PowerShell engine have been implemented in WMF 5.1:

trans-unit.source: Performance
trans-unit.target: Performance

trans-unit.source: Performance has improved in some important areas:
trans-unit.target: Performance has improved in some important areas:

trans-unit.source: Startup
trans-unit.target: Startup

trans-unit.source: Pipelining to cmdlets like ForEach-Object and Where-Object is approximately 50% faster
trans-unit.target: Pipelining to cmdlets like ForEach-Object and Where-Object is approximately 50% faster

trans-unit.source: Some example improvements (your results may vary depending on your hardware):
trans-unit.target: Some example improvements (your results may vary depending on your hardware):

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: 5.0 Time (ms)
trans-unit.target: 5.0 Time (ms)

trans-unit.source: 5.1 Time (ms)
trans-unit.target: 5.1 Time (ms)

trans-unit.source: First ever PowerShell run: `powershell -command "Unknown-Command"`
trans-unit.target: First ever PowerShell run: `powershell -command "Unknown-Command"`

trans-unit.source: Command analysis cache built: `powershell -command "Unknown-Command"`
trans-unit.target: Command analysis cache built: `powershell -command "Unknown-Command"`

trans-unit.source: Note One change related to startup might impact some unsupported scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Note One change related to startup might impact some unsupported scenarios.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell no longer reads the files `$pshome\*.ps1xml` -- these files have been converted to C# to avoid some file and CPU overhead of processing the XML files.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell no longer reads the files `$pshome\*.ps1xml` -- these files have been converted to C# to avoid some file and CPU overhead of processing the XML files.

trans-unit.source: The files still exist to support V2 side-by-side, so if you change the file contents, it will not have any effect to V5, only V2.
trans-unit.target: The files still exist to support V2 side-by-side, so if you change the file contents, it will not have any effect to V5, only V2.

trans-unit.source: Note that changing the contents of these files was never a supported scenario.
trans-unit.target: Note that changing the contents of these files was never a supported scenario.

trans-unit.source: Another visible change is how PowerShell caches the exported commands and other information for modules that are installed on a system.
trans-unit.target: Another visible change is how PowerShell caches the exported commands and other information for modules that are installed on a system.

trans-unit.source: Previously, this cache was stored in the directory `$env:LOCALAPPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\CommandAnalysis`.
trans-unit.target: Previously, this cache was stored in the directory `$env:LOCALAPPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\CommandAnalysis`.

trans-unit.source: In WMF 5.1, the cache is a single file `$env:LOCALAPPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ModuleAnalysisCache`.
trans-unit.target: In WMF 5.1, the cache is a single file `$env:LOCALAPPDATA\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ModuleAnalysisCache`.

trans-unit.source: See [Module Analysis Cache](scenarios-features.md#module-analysis-cache) for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Module Analysis Cache](scenarios-features.md#module-analysis-cache) for more details.
